action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.  
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = dizzy
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: all letters in "crane" are incorrect, so I will choose a new word with entirely different letters to maximize information.  
guess: solid

attempts = 2
target_word = dizzy
guess = solid
guess_feedback = s<red> o<red> l<red> i<yellow> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: s<red> o<red> l<red> i<yellow> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "i" and "d" are in the word but in the wrong positions, so I will include them in the next guess while avoiding "s", "o", and "l".  
guess: timid

attempts = 3
target_word = dizzy
guess = timid
guess_feedback = t<red> i<green> m<red> i<red> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: t<red> i<green> m<red> i<red> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. I will exclude "t", "m", and the second "i" while keeping "i" in the second position.  
guess: vivid

attempts = 4
target_word = dizzy
guess = vivid
guess_feedback = v<red> i<green> v<red> i<red> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: v<red> i<green> v<red> i<red> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. "v" is incorrect, so I will exclude it and try a new word with "i" in the second position and "d" in a different position.  
guess: rigid

attempts = 5
target_word = dizzy
guess = rigid
guess_feedback = r<red> i<green> g<red> i<red> d<yellow>

guess_feedback: r<red> i<green> g<red> i<red> d<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: "i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. "r" and "g" are incorrect, so I will exclude them and try a new word with "i" in the second position and "d" in a different position.  
guess: bidet

attempts = 6
target_word = dizzy
guess = bidet
guess_feedback = b<red> i<green> d<yellow> e<red> t<red>

guess_explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
all letters in "crane" are incorrect, so I will choose a new word with entirely different letters to maximize information.
"i" and "d" are in the word but in the wrong positions, so I will include them in the next guess while avoiding "s", "o", and "l".
"i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. I will exclude "t", "m", and the second "i" while keeping "i" in the second position.

"i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. "v" is incorrect, so I will exclude it and try a new word with "i" in the second position and "d" in a different position.

"i" is confirmed in the second position, and "d" is in the word but not in the fifth position. "r" and "g" are incorrect, so I will exclude them and try a new word with "i" in the second position and "d" in a different position.
